title: How to Make a Grilled Cheese Sandwich on a Griddle

steps.title: Spread butter on the griddle.
steps.content: Spread butter on the griddle. The butter will melt quickly, so make sure to spread it wherever you will put bread.

steps.title: Begin building the sandwich.
steps.content: Begin building the sandwich. Lay one slice of bread on the griddle. Then add the sliced cheese - you should have enough cheese to cover the whole piece of bread. More cheese makes for a messier sandwich, but you can add as much as you want - it's a matter of personal preference. You can also add shredded cheese on top of the sliced cheese, as this will make for a different flavor and texture, and the shredded cheese will melt more quickly than sliced cheese. If you want to add any other toppings (tomatoes, ham or turkey, vegetables, etc.), do so now.

steps.title: Top the sandwich with the other slice of bread.
steps.content: Top the sandwich with the other slice of bread.

steps.title: When the bottom piece of bread is nicely browned, flip the sandwich.
steps.content: When the bottom piece of bread is nicely browned, flip the sandwich. The bottom slice of bread should be golden brown but not burned, and the cheese should be just beginning to melt. Be careful when flipping to keep the sandwich from falling apart. If you find that the bread is browning or even burning before the cheese melts properly, turn the heat down.

steps.title: Cook until bread is browned and cheese is melted.
steps.content: Cook until bread is browned and cheese is melted. Then remove sandwich from griddle. Let cool for a minute or two, then cut in half diagonally and serve.
